tweets.html:
Now that Sight & Sound has ranked its films for the next decade, they really need to get on creating the ultimate Buffy Season Ranking list.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) August 1, 2012

"Asylum" is both the subtitle of the new #AHS season and where most of the #Glee cast will probably end up.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) August 1, 2012

Ovation's new motto is "Be Moved," which beats the former "TV For Snobs." I kid. I actually conceptually love what Ovation does.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 1, 2012

Dear TV executives: there is a night other than Sunday on which television shows are permitted to air.

— Jason Wojciechowski (@jlwoj) August 1, 2012

HBO has changed its theme from "Fuck You. We're HBO." to "HBOOOOOOOOOO, MOTHERFUCKERS!!!!!!" #officialslogans #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2012

Girls and Enlightened back together in January. Should be a good hour of "comedy." #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2012

HBO gave us a "Newsroom" notebook, in which I will write down advice I get from helpful dudes. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 1, 2012

If Larry David is writing an HBO movie starring himself but he's NOT Larry David, who is he? Then, who am I? #ExistentialCrisis

— Mark W. (@marqualler) August 1, 2012

Drove by Chick-fil-A. Last time I saw a line that white & fat, Charlie Sheen snor-- [Chris has chest pain, reaches for nitro glycerin, dies]

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) August 1, 2012

Pretty sure I just made a LOTR joke about The Newsroom. /hangs head in shame /looks around /secretly fistpumps

— Jason Wojciechowski (@jlwoj) August 1, 2012

The upcoming session for #TheNewsroom will be set against a 30-minute version of Coldplay's "Fix You." #TCAs12

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) August 1, 2012

Projected first question from press corps for Mr. Sorkin: "What is it about you that makes us hate you so much?" #TCAs12

— Andrew Wallenstein (@awallenstein) August 1, 2012

Can't wait until Newsroom covers a TCA-like session in season...yeah you know where this is going.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) August 1, 2012

Quick, someone check the transcripts of Sorkin's past TCA sessions. I think he's recycling his own quotes! #TCAs12

— Andrew Wallenstein (@awallenstein) August 1, 2012

You guys, I can't find the words to describe the face Jeff Daniels is making onstage right now. I think I'd go with "constipated leopard."

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) August 1, 2012

"I completely respect that opinion, but I 100 percent disagree with it," Sorkin says of criticisms of the female characters.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 1, 2012

Sorkin's defense for the female characters is that we see them doing their jobs well. This isn't really true, though. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2012

#AaronSorkin shoots down "untrue and unsourced" story on Internet that writing staff was fired. "I want the old gang back." #HBO #tcas12

— Bill Brioux (@BillBriouxTV) August 1, 2012

Duh, you guys. Everything on the internet is wrong. Are you even paying attention to the show?! #shorterSorkin #armchairTCA

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) August 1, 2012

Sorkin doesn't need consultants, he needs dramaturgs. #TCAs12

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) August 1, 2012

You could debate Aaron Sorkin for two weeks and he would win every point and you would be exhausted. #tcas12

— Gail Pennington (@GailPennington) August 1, 2012

Right now Jeff Daniels is thinking: "Hmmm, maybe that Dumb and Dumber sequel wasn't such a bad idea..."

— Joe Flint (@JBFlint) August 1, 2012

Poor Jeff Daniels.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) August 1, 2012

If this were an Aaron Sorkin show, he and @AlyssaRosenberg would banter for six years, then chastely wed. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2012

Summary of #Newsroom panel so far: Critics: You have a female problem and the show is a mess. Sorkin: I disagree.

— Lesley Goldberg (@Snoodit) August 1, 2012

Sorkin & Daniels kinda punted a very smart @alyssarosenberg question about the "asymmetry" between the way men & women screw up on the show.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) August 1, 2012

Aaron Sorkin doesn't write strong koala characters. RT @BurleytheKoala: *slips on banana peel*

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 1, 2012

Setting up a banana peel for my wife. That's comedy. Let's watch. #tcas12

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) August 1, 2012

Aaron Sorkin and Ryan Murphy have the exact same problem with #TheNewsroom and #TheNewNormal: huge gaps between what we and they see.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) August 1, 2012

Thought experiment: Newsroom would have mostly gotten politely disappointed reviews if it were on TNT. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2012

"There's nothing you can tell me that will help me." Jeff Daniels, to us. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2012

Jeff Daniels just said to a critic, "Does this mean you won't be knitting the baby any booties?" Kidding! That's from Terms of Endearment!

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) August 1, 2012

Every #TCA has its highly dramatic panels when very tired critics lose it. Aaron Sorkin, come on down!

— Terry Morrow (@Telebuddy) August 1, 2012

I want to make a TV show about a fictional pop culture website that has lots of episodic TV reviews set a year in the past. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2012

I need to go on a walk with someone, just so I can talk about this Sorkin TCA panel.

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) August 1, 2012

This just in critics can't take criticism... more at 10! #tca12

— Andy Kubitz (@TVKubitz) August 1, 2012

Sorkin sums up his approach as a guy who writes romantically and idealistically. Tough sell in room full of cranky critics #HBO #tcas12

— Bill Brioux (@BillBriouxTV) August 1, 2012

Well, Aaron Sorkin ends the session by saying "Thank you very much." So..there's that? #tcas12 #thenewsroom

— Marisa Roffman (@marisaroffman) August 1, 2012

That "Newsroom" panel, while minorly contentious, wasn't contentious enough to be portrayed in a S3 "Newsroom" ep.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 1, 2012

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
The Newsroom panel is over. It had its tense moments. But not 2 Broke Girls panel tense. #TCAs12

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) August 1, 2012

Disconnect btw those who like NEWSROOM/those who don't, btw Sorkin/press is just too great. Each side 100% certain. BOOM JUST LIKE POLITICS.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) August 1, 2012

Aaron Sorkin is my favorite.

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) August 2, 2012

One of the most disheartening things from the #Newsroom session today is how little Jeff Daniels appears to be acting on the show.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) August 2, 2012

Catching up on The Newsroom. Love that Olivia Munn has to wear special glasses to speak Japanese.

— Kevin Li (@kevinlig) August 2, 2012

I'd like to see an Aaron Sorkin/Human Centipede mashup. Can you imagine that Walk and Talk?

— Mark Sample (@samplereality) August 2, 2012

The first time I heard there was a film called Battleship Potemkin I wanted to watch it because it sounded like Pokemon

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) August 2, 2012

Is there a German word to describe the feeling of you get after watching 6 straight hours of HGTV?

— A.S. Paul (@aspaul) August 2, 2012

@aspaul Designenglådjë

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) August 2, 2012

Shep Smith seems like a mole sent to slowly, subtly convince Fox News viewers that gay is okay. http://t.co/h28qmb72

— McKay Coppins (@mckaycoppins) August 2, 2012

There was never just one... MT @mckaycoppins: Shep Smith seems like a mole sent to slowly, subtly convince Fox News viewers that gay is okay

— Muto-Ho-Ho! (@JoeMuto) August 2, 2012

tweets.html:
I feel like I should not be seeing the shit I am seeing on TEEN MOM right now.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) August 2, 2012

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
REVENGE! MT @Emily_VanCamp_: spent today tied to wooden post getting pummeled by cold waves. The things one will do for revenge.... :)

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) August 2, 2012

The US fencing team's helmets are bedazzling!

— brooke_edge (@brooke_edge) August 1, 2012

Which is longer: the #TCAS12, the Olympics, or Big Brother? All three are starting to feel interminable...

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) August 1, 2012

Coming up today at the #tcas12, presentations by the Lacrosse Network and UHF Channel 62.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) August 1, 2012

Sorry Olympics, the only sport i'm interested in is East Dillon football #FNL

— Lucy Fife Donaldson (@LFDonaldson) August 1, 2012

Buster Keaton was the only funny gymnast.

— Paul Whitelaw (@paulwhitelaw) August 1, 2012

Can't wait to flip on NBC in four hours and watch Vertigo upset Citizen Kane in the 3-Reel Critic Pleasing relay.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) August 1, 2012

Some Olympic badminton players were disqualified for throwing matches. Were the matches lit when they threw them? #FireHazard

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) August 1, 2012

At this point, I'm just so desensitized to badminton scandals.

— Karen Kilgariff (@KarenKilgariff) August 2, 2012

Haven't been paying attention to the Olympics much. Has Team Follow Back won any medals?

— Jason Ryan (@JasonRyGuy) August 1, 2012

Right now, NBC is showing a Silver Medalist travelling back in time to kill the Gold Medalist's mother.

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) August 1, 2012

Commentators for diving are professional tattletales.

— Greg Laswell (@GregLaswell) August 2, 2012

Jesus, NBC, you got this "what you're tweeting" idea from one of your moron local news producers, didn't you?

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) August 2, 2012

To those defending NBC's tape delay by calling them a for-profit company: you know they're giving Matthew Perry another show, right?

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) August 2, 2012

Hello James Magnussen #OlympicsSwimming

— Curt Wagner (@ShowPatrol) August 2, 2012

Oh, HELLO, James Magnussen.

— Meredith Blake (@MeredithBlake) August 2, 2012

Troy Dumais: Can get it. #ObjectificationOlympics

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) August 2, 2012

What do you guys think Al Trautwig is like at Thanksgiving? "THE TURKEY! AT ITS HOLIDAY BEST. CRAMMED WITH STUFFING FOREVER."

— Lizzie O'Leary (@lizzieohreally) August 2, 2012

Ryan Seacrest makes me long for the incisive commentary of Billy Bush.

— Meredith Blake (@MeredithBlake) August 2, 2012

Aw. Danell Leyva is Linus.

— katie benner (@ktbenner) August 2, 2012

Dear Al Trautwig: you are invited to narrate the rest of my life.

— Lizzie O'Leary (@lizzieohreally) August 2, 2012

i hate this gymnastics commentator, he makes grunting noises and i have no idea if what the guy did was good or not!

— label me mabel (@labelmemabel) August 2, 2012

Ryan Lochte is what happens when Matty from #Awkward gets a lobotomy.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) August 2, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
@TVMcGee He's like Ryan from Suburgatory, but with less wit.

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) August 2, 2012

Someone put Ryan Lochte and Karl Pilkington in a room. Like, NOW. Just let them try and form sentences that make sense.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) August 2, 2012

Fave #nbc commentary of this evening: "phelps breathes after every stroke, so he breathes more and takes more breaths". #insightful

— Heidi Stephens (@heidistephens) August 2, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
"Up next, Ryan Seacrest covers the social media reaction to-" *CLICK*

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) August 2, 2012

also, "Look at the Mexicans!" sounds less racist in Olympic play-by-play than when my Grandma says it.

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) August 2, 2012

Goodness. They finally delivered the man I ordered. #nathanadrian

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 2, 2012

NBC's Olympic coverage has made me so curious about other nations & cultures. Mostly because they are showing no other nations & cultures.

— K.P. Anderson (@ikpanderson) August 2, 2012

I don't care how many gold medals Michael Phelps wins, I still don't think it's cool how he protests at military funerals.

— Mike Leffingwell (@mikeleffingwell) August 2, 2012

BBC's awkward intercutting of CGI aerial shots of Olympic sailing with live shots is how you know they are also the makers of Doctor Who.

— Kevin Li (@kevinlig) August 2, 2012
